sp.p:
Dryads peer from the thicket as she
passes by, and the brown Fauns smile
strangely at her when she comes near
them. She has hawk-faced Gods that
worship her, and the Centaurs gallop at
her side."
yril. Is that the end of the article?

Vivian. No. There is one more passage,
but it is purely practical. It suggests
some methods by which we could
revive this lost art of Lying.

yril. Well, before you read me that, I
should like to ask you a question.
What do you mean by saying that
Life, 'poor, probable, uninteresting human
Life,' will try to reproduce the
marvels of Art? I can quite
understand your objection to Art
being treated as a mirror. You
think it would reduce genius to
the position of a cracked-looking-glass.
But you dont mean to say that
seriously believe that Life imitates
Art, that Life in fact is the
mirror? and Art the reality?
